qas.question: Besides the U.N. Headquarters, who hosts many U.N. agencies?
What does the ILO stand for?
What is disucussed at the World Economic Forum in Davos?

answers.text: important issues facing the world, including health and the environment
United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

context: Apart from the United Nations headquarters, the <a0_0>Swiss Confederation<a0_0/> is host to many UN agencies, like the World Health Organization (WHO), the <a1_0>International Labour Organization<a1_0/> (ILO), the International Telecommunication Union (ITU), the <a4_0>United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees<a4_0/> (UNHCR) and about 200 other international organisations, including the World Trade Organization and the World Intellectual Property Organization. The annual meetings of the World Economic Forum in Davos bring together top international business and political leaders from Switzerland and foreign countries to discuss <a2_0>important issues facing the world, including health and the environment<a2_0/>. Additionally the headquarters of the <a3_0>Bank for International Settlements<a3_0/> (BIS) are located in Basel since 1930.
